question: I work hard but never get the reward!
answer:
QUESTION

I want to ask from you that i alwayz wrkd hard bt never got the reward plz tel mewhat should i do?

ANSWER


Share:

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful

Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

At the outset one should understand that Almighty Allah sees and knows everything. When a servant of His makes effort in His worship or to acquire sustenance, He is well aware of those efforts. One should never lose hope in life. When things are not going well, consider it a test from Allah.

Allah Ta ̒āla says in the Holy Quran:

“And surely We will test you with something of fear and hunger and a loss of wealth and lives and fruit, but glad tidings to those who are patient.”[1]          (1:155)

We have been beautifully advised by Rasullullāh Sallallāhu ̒alayhi Wa Sallam as to what we should do at the time of need.

Rasullullāh Sallallāhu ̒alayhi Wa Sallam said:

“Whoever has a need to (ask from) Allah or man, then he should perform wuzu, a complete wuzu; then perform two Rakaats Salāh, praise Allah and send Durood on Nabi Sallallāhu ̒alayhi Wa Sallam and then say":[2]

ليقل لا إله إلا الله الحليم الكريم سبحان الله رب العرش العظيم الحمد لله رب العالمين أسألك موجبات رحمتك وعزائم مغفرتك والغنيمة من كل بر والسلامة من كل إثم لا تدع لي ذنبا إلا غفرته ولا هما إلا فرجته ولا حاجة هي لك رضا إلا قضيتها يا أرحم الراحمين

Transliteration:

Lā ilāha Il Allahul Haleemul Kareem. Subhān Allahi Rabbil ̒Arshil ̒Adheem. Alhamdulillāhi Rabbil ‘Ālameen. As aluka moojibaati Rahmatik Wa ̒Azāa ima Maghfiratik Wal Ghaneemata min kulli birr Was salāmata min kulli ithm. Lā tad ̒a li dtham bann il lā ghafarta Wa lā hamm man il lā Farr rajtahu Wa lā Hājatan Hiya laka Ridhan il lā Qadhai tahā Yā Arhamar Rā Himeen.

(Translation in footnote.)[3]

The above two Rakaats can be performed with the niyat of “Salātul Hājat” (Prayer of need).

For one’s Rizq to be made easy, maintaining family ties is also effective.

Rasullullāh Sallallāhu ̒alayhi Wa Sallam said:

“Whoever is pleased that his rizq be expanded and that his sins be forgotten then let him maintain his family ties.”[4]

                                                                                                                             (Bukhari p96. Vol.7 Darul Fikr)

This is the status of maintaining family ties. It increases ones Rizq through the will of Almighty Allah. Kindness to ones parents is even more effective in this regard.

One should also be punctual on the five daily Salāh with Jamā̒at in the Musjid. Every day after the Maghrib Salāh, one should read Surah Wāqi’ah (Para27:56th Surah), as poverty will not afflict its reader.  Apart from the five daily Salāh, also try to perform Tahajjud Salāh (Salāh performed in the last part of the night). Thereafter, make sincere du̒a for your needs and for the Rizq you require. Inshā Allah, this du̒a will be accepted.

May Almighty Allah make all matters easy for you, except your sincere efforts and fulfil your needs.

Ameen.

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum 

 

Ml. Zakariyya bin Ahmed,
Student Dārul Iftā

Checked and Approved by:
Mufti Ebrahim Desai
Dārul Iftā




[1] وَلَنَبْلُوَنَّكُمْ بِشَيْءٍ مِنَ الْخَوْفِ وَالْجُوعِ وَنَقْصٍ مِنَ الْأَمْوَالِ وَالْأَنْفُسِ وَالثَّمَرَاتِ وَبَشِّرِ الصَّابِرِين

[2]قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم من كانت له إلى الله حاجة أو إلى أحد من بني آدم فليتوضأ فليحسن الوضوء ثم ليصل ركعتين ثم ليثن على الله وليصل على النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم ثم

[3] “There is no deity except Allah. The Tolerant The noble. Glory be to Allah. Lord of the great throne. Praise be to Allah. Lord of the universe. I ask you for that which necessitate your Mercy and which will assure your forgiveness and the benefit of all good and the protection of all sin. Do not leave me with sin except that you forgive it, nor grief except that you uplift it, nor a need which is for your pleasure except that you fulfil it. Oh the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.” (Tirmidhi)

 

[4] عن أبي هريرة رضي الله عنه قال سمعت رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم يقول من سره أن يبسط له في رزقه وأن ينسأ له في أثره فليصل رحمه
